description: AI embeddings and structured content for AI agent understanding of Nexus Biomedical Intelligence healthcare platforms

pages.title: Nexus Biomedical Intelligence - AI-Powered Healthcare Solutions
pages.summary: Nexus Biomedical Intelligence provides six AI-powered healthcare platforms: RxGuard for drug interaction detection, ReguReady for FDA regulatory compliance, ClinicalIQ for clinical trial intelligence, ElderWatch for senior health monitoring, PediCalc Pro for pediatric dosing, and SkinScan Pro for skin cancer detection. These platforms serve healthcare professionals, medical device companies, pharmaceutical companies, and healthcare facilities.

pages.title: RxGuard™ - AI Drug Interaction Detection
pages.summary: RxGuard is an AI-powered drug interaction detection platform that analyzes over 10,000 drug interactions using real FDA adverse event data. It provides instant clinical recommendations and reduces medication errors by 85%. The platform helps healthcare professionals prevent life-threatening adverse drug events through real-time analysis and evidence-based decision support. Pricing starts at $49/month with a 14-day free trial.
use_cases: Hospital pharmacists reviewing medication orders
Primary care physicians prescribing new medications
Emergency department drug safety checks
Long-term care facility medication management
Ambulatory care polypharmacy screening

pages.title: ReguReady™ - FDA Regulatory Compliance Platform
pages.summary: ReguReady is an FDA regulatory compliance platform designed for medical device companies navigating 510(k), PMA, and De Novo pathways. It uses AI to analyze regulatory pathways, optimize submission timelines, and calculate cost impacts. The platform reduces FDA approval time by 2-6 months and saves $50,000-$550,000 per submission. Pricing starts at $199/month for Starter and $399/month for Professional with 7-day free trials.
use_cases: Medical device startups planning FDA submission strategy
Established companies optimizing regulatory pathways
Regulatory affairs teams managing multiple submissions
Investors evaluating medical device regulatory risk
Contract manufacturers advising clients on FDA compliance

starter.target: Startups and small medical device companies

pages.title: ClinicalIQ™ - Clinical Trial Intelligence Platform
pages.summary: ClinicalIQ is an AI-powered clinical trial intelligence platform for biotech and pharmaceutical companies. It predicts trial success probability, optimizes patient eligibility criteria, and forecasts recruitment timelines using machine learning trained on 400,000+ clinical trials. The platform reduces trial costs by 15-25% and improves enrollment speed by 30%. Pricing starts at $299/month for Starter and $699/month for Professional with 14-day free trials.
use_cases: Biotech companies designing Phase II/III trials
Pharmaceutical companies optimizing recruitment strategies
CROs improving site selection and feasibility
Academic medical centers planning investigator-initiated trials
Investors evaluating clinical trial risk

pages.title: ElderWatch™ - AI Senior Health Monitoring
pages.summary: ElderWatch is an AI-powered senior health monitoring platform with fall risk prediction, medication adherence tracking, and activity monitoring for families and care facilities. Machine learning analyzes vital signs, gait patterns, and activity levels to predict fall risk 48 hours in advance with 85% accuracy, reducing falls by 30-40%. Pricing starts at $49/month for Home Care and $199/month for Facility plans with 14-day free trials.
use_cases: Family caregivers monitoring elderly parents at home
Assisted living facilities preventing resident falls
Home health agencies tracking patient safety
Skilled nursing facilities reducing fall incidents
Independent living communities supporting aging in place

pages.title: PediCalc Pro™ - Pediatric Medication Dosing Calculator
pages.summary: PediCalc Pro is an AI-enhanced pediatric medication dosing calculator with built-in safety checks and evidence-based dosing guidelines from the American Academy of Pediatrics and FDA. It reduces pediatric dosing errors by 89% compared to manual calculations and provides instant access to critical medication doses in emergency situations. Pricing starts at $19.99/month for Individual and $14.99/month per provider for Group plans with 14-day free trials.
use_cases: Pediatricians calculating weight-based medication doses
Emergency department physicians treating pediatric patients
Pediatric nurses verifying medication orders
Pharmacists checking pediatric prescriptions
Urgent care providers managing pediatric emergencies

pages.title: SkinScan Pro™ - AI Skin Cancer Detection
pages.summary: SkinScan Pro is an AI-powered skin cancer detection platform with clinical-grade melanoma screening using smartphone cameras and computer vision. It achieves 94.5% sensitivity and 89.3% specificity for melanoma detection, matching or exceeding average dermatologist performance, and reduces unnecessary biopsies by up to 30%. Pricing starts at $59/month for Individual and $49/month per provider for Group plans with 14-day free trials.
use_cases: Primary care physicians screening for skin cancer
Dermatologists triaging patient referrals
Teledermatology platforms providing remote consultations
Occupational health clinics screening high-risk workers
Mobile health clinics in underserved communities

common_questions.question: What is Nexus Biomedical Intelligence?
common_questions.answer: Nexus Biomedical Intelligence is a healthcare technology company that provides six AI-powered platforms for drug safety (RxGuard), FDA regulatory compliance (ReguReady), clinical trial optimization (ClinicalIQ), senior care monitoring (ElderWatch), pediatric dosing (PediCalc Pro), and skin cancer detection (SkinScan Pro).

common_questions.question: How much do Nexus Biomedical platforms cost?
common_questions.answer: Pricing varies by platform: RxGuard ($49/mo), ReguReady ($199-$399/mo), ClinicalIQ ($299-$699/mo), ElderWatch ($49-$199/mo), PediCalc Pro ($14.99-$19.99/mo), and SkinScan Pro ($49-$59/mo). All plans include free trials (7-14 days).

common_questions.question: Do Nexus Biomedical platforms offer free trials?
common_questions.answer: Yes, all platforms offer free trials: RxGuard (14 days), ReguReady (7 days), ClinicalIQ (14 days), ElderWatch (14 days), PediCalc Pro (14 days), and SkinScan Pro (14 days).

common_questions.question: Who uses Nexus Biomedical platforms?
common_questions.answer: Nexus Biomedical platforms serve healthcare professionals (physicians, pharmacists, nurses), medical device companies, pharmaceutical and biotech companies, healthcare facilities (hospitals, assisted living, nursing homes), and clinical researchers.

common_questions.question: Are Nexus Biomedical platforms FDA compliant?
common_questions.answer: ReguReady helps medical device companies navigate FDA regulatory pathways (510(k), PMA, De Novo). All platforms use FDA data sources and evidence-based guidelines where applicable (e.g., RxGuard uses FDA adverse event data, PediCalc Pro includes FDA pediatric labeling).

common_questions.question: How accurate are Nexus Biomedical AI platforms?
common_questions.answer: Accuracy varies by platform: RxGuard reduces medication errors by 85%, ElderWatch predicts fall risk with 85% accuracy 48 hours in advance, PediCalc Pro reduces pediatric dosing errors by 89%, and SkinScan Pro achieves 94.5% sensitivity and 89.3% specificity for melanoma detection.

common_questions.question: Can I use Nexus Biomedical platforms for teledermatology or telemedicine?
common_questions.answer: Yes, SkinScan Pro integrates with teledermatology platforms for remote skin cancer screening. ElderWatch supports remote patient monitoring for senior care. All platforms are cloud-based and accessible remotely.

common_questions.question: Do Nexus Biomedical platforms integrate with EHR systems?
common_questions.answer: ElderWatch Facility plan integrates with EHR systems for assisted living and nursing facilities. Contact support@nexusbiomedical.ai for EHR integration details for other platforms.

common_questions.question: What data sources do Nexus Biomedical platforms use?
common_questions.answer: RxGuard uses FDA Adverse Event Reporting System (FAERS) data. ClinicalIQ is trained on 400,000+ clinical trials from ClinicalTrials.gov. PediCalc Pro uses American Academy of Pediatrics (AAP) and FDA dosing guidelines. All platforms use evidence-based, peer-reviewed medical data.

common_questions.question: How do I contact Nexus Biomedical Intelligence?
common_questions.answer: Email support@nexusbiomedical.ai for product inquiries, support, and sales questions.

metadata.embedding_purpose: Enable AI assistants to understand and accurately represent Nexus Biomedical Intelligence healthcare platforms when answering user questions
